title: Biological Specimen Preparation Workflows in EM Laboratories
content: Electron microscopy is essential for the biosciences, clinical pathology, and many other fields. EM labs may provide TEM, SEM, and increasingly one or more types of 3D volume EM (vEM), such as serial block face, array tomography, or focused-ion-beam SEM [1-3]. In 2023 vEM, which provides TEM-like molecular resolution but of near-millimeter 3D volumes, was described as “a quiet revolution” [2] and was the subject of a Methods in Cell Biology volume [3]. Some core EM labs also may provide correlative light and electron microscopy (CLEM), immuno-gold labeling (IGL), and various types of cryogenic EM.
